Uses of Packet in com.simplechat.protocol
 

Subclasses of Packet in com.simplechat.protocol
 class Packet0KeepAlive
          Keep alive packet, sent to keep client connect to server.
 class Packet1Join
          Join packet, sent by client upon joining the server.
 class Packet2Leave
          Leave packet, sent by client upon client-side leave operation.
 class Packet3Chat
          Chat packet, sent by client when a message is entered.
 class Packet4Kick
          Kick packet, sent by server to kick a client.
 class Packet5Message
          Message packet, sent by server to relay a message to a client.
 class Packet6NameChange
          Name change packet, sent by server to change a client's name.
 class Packet7Handshake
          Handshake packet, sent by server to tell client it's connected.
 class Packet8PasswordChange
          Password change packet, sent by server to change a client's password.
 

Methods in com.simplechat.protocol with parameters of type Packet

          Sends a packet to all clients except the one specified.
 void PacketHandler.sendAllPacket(Packet packet, java.util.List clients, java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
          Sends a packet to all clients.
 void PacketHandler.sendClientPacket(Packet packet, java.net.InetAddress ip, int port, java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
          Sends a packet from the client to the server.
 void PacketHandler.sendPacket(Packet packet, ClientData client, java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
          Sends a packet to a single client.
